chef.name: John Smith
chef.description: John Smith has been cooking professionally for 10 years and specializes in French cuisine.

recipes.name: Beef Bourguignon
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. 2. Cut the beef into large cubes and season with salt and pepper. 3. In a Dutch oven, cook the bacon until crispy. 4. Remove the bacon and set aside. 5. In the same pot, brown the beef on all sides. 6. Remove the beef and set aside. 7. Add the onions, carrots, and garlic to the pot and cook until softened. 8. Add the beef back to the pot along with the bacon, red wine, beef stock, tomato paste, thyme, and rosemary. 9. Bring to a simmer, then cover and transfer to the oven. 10. Bake for 2-3 hours, or until the beef is tender. Serve with crusty bread and mashed potatoes.
